bibl.title: Letter from Frank F. Law to Philip Showalter Hench, January 9, 1942

div1.p: Law informs Hench that the Wyeth Company was glad to have been associated with the yellow fever exhibit at the Mayo Clinic Library.

div1.head: Letter from Frank F. Law to Philip Showalter Hench, January 9, 1942
div1.opener:
John Wyeth & Brother
Incorporated
Manufacturing Chemists,
Philadelphia
January 9, 1942
1600 Arch Street
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Thank you for your letter of December 31, enclosing
the snapshots of the yellow fever exhibit.

The placing of the yellow fever exhibit in the Mayo
Clinic Library culminates a very worthwhile project on your
part. We are very happy to have been associated with you in
this work and frankly, feel that from a business standpoint,
it will not do us any harm.

We went beyond our usual promotional limits in this
instance and I do not think we would have had the will or the
desire to do so if it were not for your own enthusiasm. I
want you to know that we appreciate your efforts and that we
are glad we could contribute what we did.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, JOHN WYETH & BROTHER, Inc.
F F Law
President FFL:s
